text:
HPI:  68 yo M with known esophageal ca and cerebellar mass s/p fall
   with increase size of cerebellar mass on CT.
   Pt has had increased difficulty walking over past month.  Fell down on
   [**1-23**] and found to have enlarged cerebellar mass on CT s/p 3rd
   ventriculostomy [**1-24**] for decompression.
   Now s/p resection of left cerebellar met.
   PMH:Stage III esophageal cancer, R eye prosthesis, HTN, DOE, BPH
   chronic foley, Diabetes, h/o trach/PEG in [**11/2113**], h/o anemia in
   [**12/2113**], s/p cholecystectomy, cognitive impairment s/p MVC
   PSH: trach/PEG in [**11/2113**], open CCY in [**2104**], lap esophagectomy [**2115-1-11**]
   Extubated yesterday [**2-2**]
   Altered mental status (not Delirium)
   Assessment:
   -          pt is consistently oriented to person.  Oriented to place
   and time inconsistently.
   -          Extremely restless throughout shift.  Pt hangs legs over
   side rails and tries to get OOB
   -          Pt has two incisions on head one frontal, one occipital
   -          Pt NPO
   Action:
   -          Neuro [**Doctor First Name 458**] removed sutures from frontal incision
   -          Neuro checks changed to q4h
   -          Refused speech and swallow this am
   Response:
   -          Head incisions are dry and intact, open to air, Sutures
   removed from frontal incision appears approximated.  Sutures are intact
   on occipital incision, skin is reddened along suture line.
   -          Able to encourage pt to eat, pt successfully ate 1 cup of
   ensure pudding with assistance
   Plan:
   -          continue to monitor neuro status
   -          consistently monitor pt for restlessness and desire to get
   OOB
   -          continue to assess incision appearance
   -          continue to assist pt eating soft foods
   Tachycardia, Other
   Assessment:
   -          pt Tachycardic up to 130s
   Action:
   -          given 5mg IV lopressor X 2
   Response:
   -          HR decreased to 90s both incidences
   Plan:
   -          continue to monitor tachycardia
